acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3 from its 96h-LC50 = 75 mg/L for fish (Zebrafish) (AQUIRE, 2011).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, LD50 values are >5000 mg/kg for rabbits and >5000 mg/kg for rats (RTECS, 2008).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: A LC50 (4h) value of >5.14 mg/L for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)) corresponds to "Not classified". Since the saturated vapour pressure concentration for the substance was 3.20 mg/L and the test was considered to be conducted for mists, the classification criteria for dust and mist was adopted.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: A LD50 value of >2000 mg/kg for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)) corresponds to "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 or "Not classified" in GHS classification).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified since mean of 28d-BOD degradation rate tested by OECD TG301D (Closed Bottle Method) is 63% and the lactate is judged to be easily degradable from test results of other lactates (Bowmer et al, 1998), and low bioaccumulative potential is estimated (log Kow = 0.8 (PHYSPROP Database, 2009)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 4 since flash point is 71 degC (NFPA (13th, 2006)).

hazardous_to_ozone.rationale: This substance is not listed in Annexes to the Montreal Protocol.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) in the molecule which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is a report that complaints of irritation of the conjunctiva were not confirmed by examination (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). Animal test data are not available. Based on these information, classification was not possible due to lack of data.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, there is a result of "moderate irritation" after application to the skin of rabbits (RTECS (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is a report that occupational exposures results in irritation of the pharyngeal and laryngeal mucosa, with coughing and some workers complained of sleepiness and headache after work (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). This information indicate that the substance may possible cause damage to the respiratory system and nervous system. Classification was not possible due to lack of sufficient data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a report that prolonged exposures of humans resulted in irritation of the pharyngeal and laryngeal mucosa, with coughing, headache and sleepiness (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). A second report states: "Symptoms; irritation nose and throat, drowsiness, headache, central nervous system depression. Target Organs; respiratory system, central nervous system" (NIOSH Pocket Guide to Chemical Hazards (2005)). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects).
